title: Advances in Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)

author: Annie Pauzie, INRETS - The French National Institute for Transport and Safety Research

segmentation: Thank you very much for the introduction.

So indeed I'm going to open the session talking about human machine direction because you have all this new technology information and communication technology in the car and I'm going to talk in terms of human factors.
What does it mean to implement this new functions inside the vehicle?
So.
I would say it's a challenging dump of human machine interaction while implementing these systems where you challenge, we need to the driver we have to deal with several functions inside the car.

So then are you as human factor we have to ensure that this new function will clearly support the driver in this task with positive consequences in terms of Rd safety and then we have a work to ensure the correct design of these functions.
A correct matching between the functions and the needs and requirements of the travels.
And then we have to develop correct methodology that will allow to evaluate how these systems are transforming the driving task in which way.
So why you change?
Because we have several type of devices nowadays that are available in the car.
So you have integrated system that are implemented by car manufacturers.
You have aftermarket systems and of course you have the nomadic devices that are brought by the driver inside the car in use while driving.

You have when you challenge because we have various types of functions or so we have the function that informs the driver about some events that are supposed to anticipate the driver to anticipate about events, but still the driver is fully in control about the car.
You have also informating system that are giving information to the driver that are not relevant with the driving task that what we cause.
I miss systems.
Then you have another category of type of systems that are assistant systems like other system where here the system is taking control or at least partly controls the driving task.

So there is 2 type of questions, two types of issues in terms of human factors because it's two type of categories and it's a challenge to really well design the two categories of systems in order to improve Rd safety because of progressive.

Noble the type of challenge is drivers population of course, because then all these functions, all these devices up to after fit with all these various types of functional drivers you have no vest virus that are building up their experience, so it's typical some type of needs and requirements for this type of populations.
You have elderly drivers that are some discrepancy in terms of functional abilities, but they have.

Strong experience, so there's a specificity and then the function that will be available after fit with this elderly drivers that we know are going to be more and more important in the future then you are professional drivers also and like.
Professional drivers that have specific requirements links to their jobs and more and more profession are using an information and communication technology in order to fulfill some job objectives.
And then of course is the task of the professional is very much transformed by this system.
Inside the car.
Another challenge is dealing with some maturity of the technology.
We have to be aware that what is observed one day.
Maybe it's going to be very different in six months or one year because this type of technology is evolving very quickly and such as certain.
As example is a mobile phone where you have all generation but not that old and new generation giving a GPS information about navigation to the driver and then you can see.
The huge difference in terms of human machine interaction according to these two type of generation of mobile phones.
So what's about Rd safety while implementing this type of functions?

Of course the the interesting goal is to improve the road safety, and it's clearly a goal at the European level about the White paper that make the ambitious goal, but at least it's it's an objective to reduce 50% of the of the road fatalities by 2010.
And wrong fault of this way to reach this ambitious goal would be to develop and to success in implementing efficient information in a system systems.
And there are several European projects that are funded with this clear goal for for many years now, and there are some positive results that show that it's a good.
It's a good.

To reach this way, but there is user face of the of the issues here that we know also that this type of systems can decrement the situation by improving increasing the distraction of the driver and making indifference and having very negative consequences in terms of Rd safety, increasing the number of crashes in regarding to.
A situation where there is no system at all.
So what type of actions are called into this context?
Several actions as being conducted by the Europe at this stage and several types of actions that have been the development in terms of design and implementation of some recommendation.
the European statement of principle.
A good example where through the hard work of doing many years reportes have been produced in order to gather some kind of key issues with.
Guarding the human machine interaction design, some main rules, so main recommendation and that has been agreed by the main actors dealing with this design.
There is also work dealing with to understand what the drivers population needs according to this function.
What do they really need?
If you really if you manage to feel fulfilled the needs then you will succeed in improving the task.
That's difficulties to really identify how what type of functions are required by the driver by which driver.
And it is partly the work that has been conducted is in the network of accidents.
Humanist humanist dealing for human centric design for Information Society technologies.
Another aspect is to develop methodologies because when we implement functions, we need to evaluate the consequences of the use of them.

So a methodology's is also a lot of work that has been conducted in past European projects, such As for example, ID or reminisced, but there are many others and we I think we improve according to what is the robust methodology in order to evaluate the safety when you implement this type of systems.

And there are more technological solution like again the project 80 where you develop intelligent manager of functions inside the car in order to integrate all the various types of functions possible.
And of course you have also work conducted by the international group like EOIE Action.
Play.
So here you are, just a brief overview of all the European projects that have been funded by the DG Information Society.
And so you have integrated project network of excellence.
Everything is around improving and accelerating.
The implementation of this.
New technologies.
Again, I took about the European statement of principle.

Maybe you are not aware about this activities and if you are interested you can get the report on the website of the DG Information Society and it's really gathering a lot of what has been agreed regarding the design and some.
He rule implementations of assistance agreed at the European level.
What is the prospective according to this issue, human machine interaction?

First of all, nomadic devices we talk about it when we write the report on European statement of principle, but we have to be aware that this nomadic devices are going to increase drastically in the future and nomadic devices is related to systems that are brought by the driver inside the car.
Meaning that they were not designed previously to be used while driving.
In contrary, with system that are integrated by car manufacturers.
So they were it's big issues in terms of human machine interaction.
Fender professional drivers here.

Some pictures taken by Souza French server that has been conducted among professional drivers and you can evaluate what is complexity and the various types of way each profession integrated more or less safely.
Systems inside the car.
And so you imagine that there are still a lot of work to do according to this issue of professional drive.
Shows new perspective that is not curable.
European statement of principle.

So there is a lot of work to do with that and there are two European projects that have been funded by the DG Information Society on this topic and by the digital TV also about motorbike because there are already some in.
I would say in vehicle but on board systems dealing with motorbike activity and task and of course here game there is a lot of data to be gathered according to this.
Question of design for the motorbike.
Perspective in terms of assistance systems?
Because when you develop systems with that is going to take control in the place of the driver, then you have to be sure that is.
There will have no counter effect for the driver.
So a lot of research has been conducted in this area, but lot of research still needs to be conducted because this area is evolving very quickly and we have.

To be clearly understand what are the rules for the design and the recommendation in order not to develop subsystem that could increase road and safety, which is not of course the goal at the beginning.

If this does, systems are well developed, it can be very great support for the for the road safety, because electronic can be more efficient than human, but as long as electronic systems is correctly.
Fitting with what the human was expecting in this critical context.
Again, some data about the increasing of the elderly population.
We have to be aware we know that this pressure is going to increase and maybe new technology can be a chance for this population.

It can be like a compound electronic compensation for some efficiencies, so why not focus also on this specific population in terms of human machine interaction and be able to develop function that are really adapted to this elderly drivers population.
And to finish, just to remind that the European Commission is working very much on this question of human machine interactions.
And it's included in the broader program in terms of equal intelligence with cleaner, safer and smarter.
Thank you very much.
Thank you very much.
Thank you so much honey.
Is there any question for Doctor Percy?
Yes please.
OK, thank you very much for the presentation.

I was struck by something a point you made earlier in your presentation about the difficulties of for particular sectors of community, and for obvious reasons, particularly interested in the older driver.

I mean with the prospect more and more all drivers on or with, because people like me have grown up and have no other way of getting around and the motor car I was thinking about whether you could turn the problem in his head and actually say you could do more with technology to help the older drivers driving longer rather than see them as a problem.
Do you see any potential for that?
Sure, they're curious.
Sure there is potential for that.

Because difficulties of elderly drivers are clearly identified when driving, so the next step and there are already some project about that is how to develop relevant functions in order to support this specific difficulties.
And, for example, turn if you are in not in UK turn right, but in France is turn left and then you have to anticipate when the cars are coming.
It's typical from elderly and it's very well identified.
And they've been already some system that we're able to inform the driver and to compensate about the feeling of the speed of the cars coming, which is where the difficulty.
So it's clearly clearly a good chance I think.
And when I talking about electronic conversation, of course it's it's a purpose for even for younger drivers it is not able to perceive something.
Then the electronic allow him to perceive that for the for the elderly driver, because some kind of.
Slowing this, I would say and driving task means to be a quick reactions right?
So really I mean it's a good chance and I believe it will be a good chance.
But maybe take can take more time because we really have to take that into consideration at this stage as a European project.
I think in the project exist as too few their existing, but maybe it would require more energy in this sector.
